id: Robin Thicke and pregnant girlfriend April Love Geary put on a brave face after losing home in California wildfires
paragraph: 135.6m sharesLast week, Robin Thicke shared the devastating news that his home had been among those destroyed by the deadly California wildfires.The 41-year-old singer and his pregnant girlfriend April Love Geary – who already have eight-month-old daughter Mia together – shared heartbreaking images of the charred wreckage of their home after the Woolsey Fire swept inland and ripped through a number of celebrity mansions in the Malibu area.Though the family home was completely incinerated – months before April gives birth to their second child together – the couple appeared to try and put the events of the last week behind them as they stepped out for lunch in Beverly Hills on Friday.Keeping it casual in matching leather jackets and dark sunglasses, Robin and April, 24, seemed in good spirits and smiled as they waited for their car to arrive.It comes after Robin confirmed the family were safe and well in the wake of the fire, after sharing their terrifying evacuation story online.Taking to Instagram last week, the record producer paid tribute to the emergency services who were working tirelessly to quell the blaze and called on his followers to make a donation to Red Cross to help those affected.‘April, Julian [Robin’s son with ex-wife Paula Patton], Mia and I would like to thank the courageous firefighters and volunteers,’ he wrote on the photo-sharing site.‘As we drove to safety, they risked their lives trying to save our home. We are safe and surrounded by friends and family.‘We thank you for all the love and support we’ve received and we send our love and prayers to everyone affected by the fires. Count your blessings!’Earlier in the week, both Robin and April shared shocking images of their home consumed by flames, with plumes of dark smoke seen rising from the ground and engulfing the Malibu area.Sharing an image of the front gates of their house blocked by a fallen tree, April wrote: ‘Our house is gone’ with a crying-face emoji.Meanwhile, Robin shared a heartbreaking image of eight-year-old son Julian crouching among the charred wreckage, writing: ‘Contemplating next move…’ Contemplating next move…A post shared by  Robin Thicke (@robinthicke) on Nov 9, 2018 at 11:21pm PSTOther stars to have their homes destroyed in the devastating Woolsey Fires include Miley Cyrus and her fiance Liam Hemsworth and Gerard Butler, while some – like Jada and Will Smith and the Kardashians – remain blocked from their homes as emergency serves asses the damage.Jada and her daughter Willow Smith were seen visiting the Malibu area near their $42 million (£32 million) mansion on Wednesday and appeared concerned as they likely attempted to find out information about their property.If you've got a story, video or pictures get in touch with the Metro.co.uk Entertainment team by emailing us celebtips@metro.co.uk, calling 020 3615 2145 or by visiting our Submit Stuff page - we'd love to hear from you.MORE: Harry and Meghan ‘might have to leave Kensington palace as minor royal won’t move’MORE: Has Kris Boyson split from Katie Price again?
